title: 105_hr4093
content: The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" is cited as the short title. It establishes a standard relating to hospital lengths of stay for group health plans under the Public Health Service Act. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" requires group health plans to provide inpatient coverage for a medically appropriate period determined by a physician. It prohibits denying eligibility based on coverage requirements, penalizing providers for following the act, offering incentives to reduce inpatient stays, or requiring preauthorization for length of stay determination. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" mandates group health plans to cover inpatient stays as determined by a physician, prohibits denying eligibility based on coverage requirements, penalizing providers for compliance, offering incentives to reduce stays, or requiring preauthorization for stay length. The Secretary will establish an appeals process and penalties for violations. Compliance with notice requirements under ERISA is also required. The Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include new requirements for employee retirement plans. Section 2723(c) is also amended to include additional sections. "SEC. 713. STANDARDS FOR HOSPITAL LENGTHS OF STAY." Group health plans and health insurance issuers must provide inpatient coverage for a medically appropriate period determined by a physician. They are prohibited from denying eligibility based on coverage requirements, penalizing providers for following these guidelines, offering incentives to reduce inpatient stays, or requiring preauthorization for length of stay determinations. The Secretary will establish an appeals process and penalty for plans or issuers that violate the provisions of this section, treating it as a material modification in the terms of the plan for notice purposes. The text describes modifications in the terms of a plan for notice purposes, including conforming and clerical amendments to specific sections of the Act. The text introduces a new section, SEC. 2752, which establishes standards for hospital lengths of stay in individual health insurance plans. The provisions of section 2706 apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market. A health insurance issuer must comply with notice requirements as if they were a group health plan. Effective dates for plan years beginning on or after January 1, 1999. The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) apply to plan years starting on or after January 1, 1999, with a special rule for collective bargaining agreements. The amendments also apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market on or after January 1, 1999. Additionally, coordinated regulations are amended to ensure compliance with the provisions of part 7 of subtitle B of title. The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 amendments apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market starting January 1, 1999. Coordinated regulations are updated to align with specific provisions of related laws.
